markdownRemark.html:
Keris peninggalan Senopati Kerajaan Sumedang Larang menjadi koleksi Pusaka Keraton Sumedang Larang. Terdapat beragam ciri, bentuk, luk, ukiran, pendok, warangka, dan ukuran-ukuran keris dari senopati ini

Keris-keris para Senopati ini merupakan keris-keris yang kuat, luhur dan tangguh sesuai dengan kedudukan dan tugas dari para Senopati Kerajaan Sumedang Larang yang terkenal gagah berani dan Pantang Mundur. Terdapat beragam keris-keris dari Para Senopati kerajaan Sumedang Larang yang tersimpan dalam lemari-lemari kaca yang tersusun rapi dan cantik. Keris-keris ini menandakan perjalanan sejarah Sumedang yang panjang dan gemilang jaman dahulu. Dari bentuk dan cirinya keris-keris mampu menceritakan tentang senjata pusaka dari pemiliknya. Dan ini menambah kekayaan khasanah senjata pusaka Keraton Sumedang Larang.

frontmatter.title: Keris Para Senopati
frontmatter.textEnglish: The heirloom of the Nagasasra Keris II belongs to Raden Adipati Aria Surinagara (Kusumadinata IX or Prince Kornel). This keris was carried and held when Prince Kusumadinata IX faced and shook hands with Governor General Daendels (1811). Keris Nagasasra II is a witness to the history of Prince Kornel in defending the people of Sumedang to make the Post weigh Cadas Prince way. The Nagasasra II Keris is preserved and becomes an icon of the heirloom of the Sumedang Larang Palace. We should be proud of Adipati Surianagara  and his keris.

frontmatter.title: Keris Panunggul Naga
frontmatter.textEnglish: The Panunggul Naga keris, whose name is the dragon's arm, contains a noble and  the great meaning is the legacy of Ratu Pucuk Umun to his son, Prabu Geusan Ulun. The Panunggul Naga Keris has a distinctive shape inlaid with gemstones decorated with beautiful floral motifs, adding to the majesty and beauty of the keris. The Panunggul Naga Keris is one of the icons from the heirloom of the Sumedang Larang Palace. Now its  stored in the Heirloom building of the Sumedang Larang palace as the majesty, glory, valor of the Sumedang Larang palace.

frontmatter.title: Keris Raden Gali Kencana
frontmatter.textEnglish: The Raden Gali Kencana keris is a pair of the Kidadap Samekti Keris, the family heirloom of Raden Sasmita. The Raden Gali Kencana keris has a length of 203 cm, made in 1630 by Ki Ageng Setrageni, there are paintings along the surface of the keris, it has a tanjeg aura for leadership, degrees and height as well as family protection. The Raden Gali Kencana keris is one of the pride and uniqueness of the heirlooms of the Sumedang Larang Palace
